name: Raj Chowdhury
bio: Raj is a passionate chef with over 10 years of experience in Indian cuisine. He loves experimenting with new flavors and creating unique dishes that bring people together.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a bowl, mix together the chicken, yogurt, garlic, ginger, cumin, paprika, and salt to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned.
3. Add diced tomatoes and cook until soft and saucy. Add heavy cream and simmer for a few minutes.
4. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and blend to a fine puree.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook until fragrant.
3. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and saut√© for a few minutes. 
4. Add the coriander powder, turmeric, and salt. Cook for another minute.
5. Add the spinach puree and cook for 5-7 minutes.
6. Add the cubed paneer and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
7. Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another minute.
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Soak basmati rice for half an hour and boil in water with a little salt. When cooked, drain and keep aside. 
2. In a pan, heat oil and fry onions until golden brown.
3. Add diced tomatoes and chicken and fry for 5-7 minutes. 
4. Add spices and fry for a few minutes. 
5. Add the cooked rice and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 10 minutes.
6. Serve hot with raita and salad.

name: Anjali
bio: Anjali is a seasoned chef with over 12 years of experience in Indian cuisine. She specializes in creating dishes that are both flavorful and healthy.

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight. Boil in water until soft.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until golden brown.
3. Add the ginger and garlic and cook for a few minutes.
4. Add the cooked lentils and beans to the skillet and mix well.
5. Add garam masala, salt, and cream. Mix well and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
6. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Chicken Korma
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until golden brown.
2. Add the ginger and garlic and cook for a few minutes.
3. Add the chicken and cook until browned.
4. In a blender, blend yogurt and cashews to make a paste.
5. Add the yogurt-cashew paste to the skillet and mix well.
6. Add garam masala, salt, and cream. Mix well and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
7. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Paneer Butter Masala
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until golden brown.
2. Add the ginger and garlic and cook for a few minutes.
3. Add diced tomatoes and cook until soft.
4. In a blender, blend the tomato-onion mixture to a smooth puree.
5. Heat a little butter in a separate skillet. Add cubed paneer and fry until golden brown.
6. Add the tomato-onion puree to the skillet and mix well.
7. Add kasuri methi, garam masala, salt, and cream. Mix well and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Bridia Sharma
bio: Bridia sharma is a skilled chef with over 8 years of experience in Indian cuisine. He is passionate about creating dishes that are not only delicious but also visually appealing.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Marinate the chicken in a mixture of yogurt, ginger, garlic, and spices for at least 2 hours.
2. Grill the marinated chicken until cooked.
3. In a large skillet, heat oil and add onions. Cook until golden brown.
4. Add ginger and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add diced tomatoes and cook until soft.
6. Add cream and mix well.
7. Add grilled chicken and cook for another 5 minutes.
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Boil spinach in water for 5-7 minutes. Drain and let it cool.
2. Blend the boiled spinach to make a smooth puree.
3. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onions and cook until golden brown.
4. Add ginger and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add the spinach puree and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
6. Add garam masala and salt to taste.
7. Add cubed paneer and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
8. Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cut potatoes and cauliflower into small pieces.
2. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add cumin seeds and cook for 1-2 minutes.
3. Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.
4. Add ginger and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
5. Add diced tomatoes and cook until soft.
6. Add potatoes and cauliflower and mix well.
7. Add garam masala and salt to taste.
8. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes.
9. Serve hot with rice or naan.
